de.tub.pes.syscir.engine

Class TransformerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tub.pes.syscir.engine.TransformerFactory

  • public class TransformerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Joachim Fellmuth, Marcel Pockrandt This factory is a static singleton that provides the whole system with classes which are introduced through configuration files. This way of decoupling allows for a great flexibility in those parts of the system which where classes are assigned to external constructs, such as transformer classes to XML KaSCPar nodes.

    By using the methods defined in this class, the system engine itself is able to perform the whole transformation process without knowing any of the specialized classes that actually run it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CONFIG_FOLDER
      Name of the folder where to find the configuration files, relative to the class base folder.
      static java.lang.String FUNCTIONS_DEFINITION_FILE
      Name of the function definition file, that contains the classes that implement the logic of special known functions.
      static java.lang.String SIMPLE_TYPES_DEFINITION_FILE
      Name of the simple types definition file.
      static java.lang.String TRANSFORMERS_DEFINITION_FILE
      Name of the transformer definition file, that contains XML-node -> transformer class name mappings.
      static java.lang.String TYPES_DEFINITION_FILE
      Name of the types definition file, that contains links to classes and other files that give reference implementations of special known SystemC types.

        public static final java.lang.String TYPES_DEFINITION_FILE
        Name of the types definition file, that contains links to classes and other files that give reference implementations of special known SystemC types. See documentation for detains on how to create such a reference implementation.

      • SIMPLE_TYPES_DEFINITION_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String SIMPLE_TYPES_DEFINITION_FILE
        Name of the simple types definition file. It contains the names of all simple C++ and SystemC base types which can be transformed to 'int' during the transformation without further effort.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isSimpleType

        public static boolean isSimpleType(java.lang.String name)
        To determine if a given type is considered a simple type (can be transformed as 'int'). Returns true if so, else false.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the type to test
        Returns:
        true if simple type, else false

      • getTransformer

        public static Transformer getTransformer(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Obtains and returns an implementation class for the given node name. If the transformer has already been used before, it can be found in the transformers map. If it is used for the first time, the referenced transformer class has to be loaded into the runtime. See createTransformer(String) for details. Returns NoEffectTransformer if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        nodeName -
        Returns:
        transformer implementation class for node

      • getTransformer

        public static Transformer getTransformer(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Alternative notation for getTransformer(String). Gets the string name out of the node before obtaining the transformer.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:

      • getFunctionTransformer

        public static KnownFunctionTransformer getFunctionTransformer(java.lang.String name)
        Obtains and returns an implementation class for the given SystemC method. If the function transformer has already been used before, it can be found in the functions map. If it is used for the first time, the referenced function transformer class has to be loaded into the runtime. See #createFunction(String) for details. Returns null if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

      • getTypeTransformer

        public static KnownTypeTransformer getTypeTransformer(java.lang.String name,
                                      Environment e)
        Obtains and returns an implementation class for the given internal SystemC type. If the assigned type transformer has already been used before, it can be found in the functions map. If it is used for the first time, the referenced type transformer class has to be loaded into the runtime. See #createFunction(String) for details. Returns null if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
